p: Any change to the climate presents a significant threat to a garden growing plants outside their natural range, but with careful plant selection and expert horticultural care we can transition the landscape to one more suited to Melbourne's emerging climate. Familiar plants can be moved to new locations and new and equally beautiful species added to the palette. The Landscape Succession Strategy is the first of its kind for botanic gardens in Australia, and possibly the world; it is set to become a blueprint for other botanic gardens planning for climate change adaption.
